contents.content:
Active star-forming regions can be identified in spiral galaxies in locations where there are:

  • fuzzy patches of hydrogen gas emitting red light.
  • areas with hot young stars emitting large amounts of blue and ultraviolet light.

By combining three or more filters that include red, blue, and ultraviolet wavelengths, you can locate the star-forming regions in a galaxy, such as the galaxy at right.
